DataElement.preferredDefinition: The collection of values for biospecimen test as defined by the sponsor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._used informally to mean a class of things.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Concepts.definition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Property.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.:used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
used informally to mean a class of things.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Biospecimen Test Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.: The act or business of transporting goods.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The act or business of transporting goods.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.: Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process of shipping something from one facility to another, usually to a customer or end user, or to a more specialized facility.

Concepts.definition: The process of shipping something from one facility to another, usually to a customer or end user, or to a more specialized facility.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Analyzing DNA to look for a genetic alteration that may indicate an increased risk for developing a specific disease or disorder.

Concepts.definition: The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The study of the biochemical and physiological effects of drugs and the mechanisms of their actions, including the correlation of actions and effects of drugs with their chemical structure, also, such effects on the actions of a particular drug or drugs.: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: The study of the biochemical and physiological effects of drugs and the mechanisms of their actions, including the correlation of actions and effects of drugs with their chemical structure, also, such effects on the actions of a particular drug or drugs.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.:An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]:Clearly characterized or delimited.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
